{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.05173v1", "title": "Conjugate generation of sporadic almost simple groups", "summary": "As defined by Guralnick and Saxl, given a nonabelian simple group $S$ and its
nonidentity automorphism $x$, a natural number $\alpha_S(x)$ is the minimum
number of conjugates of $x$ in $\langle x,S\rangle$ that generate a subgroup
containing $S$. In this paper, for every sporadic group $S$ other than the
Monster and an automorphism $x$ of $S$ of prime order, we complete the
determination of the precise value of $\alpha_S(x)$.", "main_category": "math.GR", "categories": "math.GR", "published": "2025-05-08T12:20:54Z"}
